greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = least positive k such that the remainder when 3^k is divided by k is n.
comment: a(n) > n. Numbers n such that a(n-1) = n are listed in A015949.
a(n) for which no value is currently known: n = 394, 494, 634, 730, 974, 986, 1000, ...
link: Fausto A. C. Cariboni, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000 with -1 for large entries where a(n) has not yet been found, Nov 23 2016 [With 162 new terms, this supersedes the earlier table from Robert G. Wilson v et al.]
Robert G. Wilson v et al., Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000 with -1 for those entries where a(n) has not yet been found
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 31 2002
